northwest.name: Northwest
northwest.details: Water is warm (75째F). Rough conditions. strong trades winds.

honolua.name: Honolua Bay
honolua.description: Marine Life Conservation District with 50% more fish diversity than other reefs. Best 8am-noon in summer. Check conditions from lookout - water should be blue, not milky. If surfers are present, conditions are too rough.
honolua.conditions: Extremely dangerous ocean conditions with huge waves and strong currents.

kapalua.name: Kapalua Bay
kapalua.description: Small protected cove ideal for beginners and families. Reefs on both sides block swell. Best snorkeling on northeastern side where visibility is better. Very sensitive to winter swells.
kapalua.conditions: Hazardous conditions with strong winds and rising surf, though partially protected.

napili.name: Napili Bay
napili.description: Sheltered crescent bay popular with families. Sandy bottom with reef on both sides. Good for beginners on calm days. Sea turtles frequently visit.
napili.conditions: Still dangerous but slightly better due to being more sheltered.

kaanapali.name: Ka'anapali
kaanapali.details: Water is warm (75째F). Rough conditions. strong trades winds.

blackrock.name: Black Rock (Pu'u Keka'a)
blackrock.description: Iconic lava rock formation with excellent turtle sightings. Easy beach access with nearby amenities. Watch for cliff jumpers and stay close to shore. Can get crowded but accessible for all skill levels.
blackrock.conditions: Very rough conditions with strong currents and hazardous waves.

kahekili.name: Kahekili (Airport Beach)
kahekili.description: Less crowded alternative to Black Rock with excellent reef system. Sandy entry leads to vibrant coral gardens. Morning visits recommended before afternoon winds.
kahekili.conditions: Partially protected but still facing dangerous surf and strong winds.

malawharf.name: Mala Wharf
malawharf.description: Historic pier ruins create an artificial reef teeming with marine life. Excellent for spotting turtles, rays, and diverse fish species. Entry from nearby boat ramp. Best in calm conditions.
malawharf.conditions: Conditions vary. Check locally before entering.

southshore.name: South Shore
southshore.summary: Waves present. Most hazardous near Makena/Wailea.
southshore.details: Water is warm (75째F). Rough conditions. strong trades winds.

olowalu.name: Olowalu
olowalu.description: Mile Marker 14 reef with extensive coral formations. Shallow water perfect for beginners. Known for turtle sightings. Best before noon when winds pick up.
olowalu.conditions: Relatively calm early but conditions may deteriorate with increasing winds.

coralgardens.name: Coral Gardens
coralgardens.description: Popular boat snorkel destination with vibrant coral formations and abundant marine life. Shallow reef teeming with tropical fish. Watch for boat traffic.
coralgardens.conditions: Protected area, calm early but could become rough later.

kamaole1.name: Kamaole Beach I
kamaole1.description: Family-friendly beach with lifeguards. Best snorkeling off south end near rocky reef. Smooth sandy entry ideal for beginners. Visibility can be poor due to sandy bottom.
kamaole1.conditions: South-facing and relatively calm, but conditions may change quickly.

kamaole2.name: Kamaole Beach II
kamaole2.description: Middle beach with reef between Kam I and III. Good snorkeling around lava rock outcroppings on both ends. Lifeguards, restrooms, and showers available.
kamaole2.conditions: Calm conditions early, but watch for potential roughness later.

kamaole3.name: Kamaole Beach III
kamaole3.description: Largest of the three Kamaole beaches with grassy park. Best snorkeling near north end rocks. Popular with families, has playground. Lifeguards on duty.
kamaole3.conditions: Calm early but could become hazardous as winds increase.

uluabeach.name: Ulua Beach
uluabeach.description: Excellent beginner spot in Wailea. Gentle sandy entry with lava fingers housing diverse marine life. Best snorkeling on right side toward Andaz hotel. Sea turtles common.
uluabeach.conditions: Protected cove, relatively calm but conditions may worsen.

waileapoint.name: Wailea Point
waileapoint.description: Rocky point between Wailea beaches with good reef structure. More advanced entry over rocks. Diverse fish populations and occasional turtle sightings.
waileapoint.conditions: More exposed, but still relatively calm early in the day.

changssouth.name: Chang's South
changssouth.description: Local favorite near Makena Surf condos. Excellent coral formations and fish diversity. Part of Turtle Town area.
changssouth.conditions: Calm conditions early, but be cautious of changing weather.

fivegraves.name: Five Graves (Five Caves)
fivegraves.description: Named for 5 Chinese settler headstones nearby. Features underwater caves. Advanced entry over lava rocks.
fivegraves.conditions: Exposed area, calm early but conditions could change rapidly.

makenalandingnorth.name: Makena Landing North
makenalandingnorth.description: Gateway to Turtle Town with sandy entry. One of the best spots in Hawaii for sea turtle encounters. Family-friendly with restrooms and grassy park. Boat traffic in morning.
makenalandingnorth.conditions: Calm conditions early, but monitor for potential roughness.

makenalandingsouth.name: Makena Landing South
makenalandingsouth.description: Southern access to Turtle Town. Excellent for experienced snorkelers seeking less crowded conditions. Strong currents possible.
makenalandingsouth.conditions: More exposed than north, but still relatively calm for now.

maluaka.name: Maluaka Beach
maluaka.description: Beautiful sandy beach with easy entry. Turtle cleaning station nearby makes sightings almost guaranteed. Great for beginners and families.
maluaka.conditions: Protected sandy beach, calm early but watch for changing conditions.

whiterock.name: White Rock
whiterock.description: Snorkeling is excellent around the rocky outcroppings at both ends of the beach, with the south end being a bit larger and slightly clearer.
whiterock.conditions: Rocky entry but calm conditions early; be cautious of changes.

ahihikinau.name: Ahihi-Kinau Marine Preserve
ahihikinau.description: Protected Natural Area Reserve with pristine reef. No fishing allowed so fish thrive. Reef-safe sunscreen only. $5 parking fee for non-residents. Turtle cleaning station at south end of cove.
ahihikinau.conditions: Protected marine reserve, calm early but conditions may worsen.
